result.execSummary:
The defendant Sierra M Linder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $928.00 plus surcharges - to be paid joint and several with Co-Defendants to US Bank, to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

No contact with the victim listed in the complaint or any co-actors.
Provide DNA Sample if not already done.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Prison
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Sierra M Linder in court, in custody, with Attorney Christopher Ehrfurth for Attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #2 on amended information.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #2.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Ehrfurth makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 1/2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT 
  -  1 1/2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -          2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____No contact with: Co-actors or victim listed in criminal complaint
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  $928.00 - Joint & several with Co-Defendant's - paid to US Bank (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  9 MONTHS straight time (172 days credit) - last 2 months STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
 
**Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations**
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.

Defendant to have no contact with codefendants/victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.    Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.

Defendant Sierra M Linder in court, in custody, with attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Detective Paula Hoffa from Hartland Police Department, sworn in and testified. Cross examination by Atty. Kuchler. State rests. No testimony provided by the defense. State moves for bind over and provides closing statements. Atty. Kuchler objects to bind over and provides closing statements.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Atty. Kuchler makes a Motion to Modify Bail. State does not object to the modification. Court modifies bail.  Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
